content.raw:
oh I see. So if we know the event is coming from `MEUserCmdManager` then don't create the new command in ModelCreator right? 

Would this work: Use a flag in `MEUserCmdManager`'s `Undo()` / `Redo()` functions to indicate that undo/redo is in progress and in `ModelCreator`'s callback function check and see if `MEUserCmdManager`'s flag is set before the `NewCmd` call?
content.html:
oh I see. So if we know the event is coming from MEUserCmdManager then don't create the new command in ModelCreator right?

Would this work: Use a flag in MEUserCmdManager's Undo() / Redo() functions to indicate that undo/redo is in progress and in ModelCreator's callback function check and see if MEUserCmdManager's flag is set before the NewCmd call?

pull_request.title: Model Editor: Undo inserting / deleting model plugins

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Undo inserting / deleting model plugins

content.raw: I could create a separate event just to register commands maybe?
content.html: I could create a separate event just to register commands maybe?

pull_request.title: Model Editor: Undo inserting / deleting model plugins

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Undo inserting / deleting model plugins

content.raw:
That's the problem, we have to register the new command before the event is sent. The same event is also sent for undo/redo the command, so we don't want  a new command to be created every time it is undone.

The first time I implemented this, the user command manager was a singleton, so we could just access it here. But now that it belongs to the ModelCreator, it's trickier to get to it from other widgets. Any ideas on how we could avoid depending on many other widgets?
content.html:
That's the problem, we have to register the new command before the event is sent. The same event is also sent for undo/redo the command, so we don't want a new command to be created every time it is undone.

The first time I implemented this, the user command manager was a singleton, so we could just access it here. But now that it belongs to the ModelCreator, it's trickier to get to it from other widgets. Any ideas on how we could avoid depending on many other widgets?

pull_request.title: Model Editor: Undo inserting / deleting model plugins

pullrequest.title: Model Editor: Undo inserting / deleting model plugins

content.raw: one concern I have is that now we're adding `ModelCreator`, `Mainwindow`, and `MEUserCmdManager` dependencies to more classes. It would be nice to keep them independent
content.html: one concern I have is that now we're adding ModelCreator, Mainwindow, and MEUserCmdManager dependencies to more classes. It would be nice to keep them independent
